title: How to get information from the ETH node(geth) about the USDT token

body:
The example code is very confusing, to me. 
- You have a block with transactions, why do you need to spin up a new routine to fetch them by hash via ethclient? 
- Why do you call `wg.Done()`, when you have no `wg.Add(1)`, nor `wg.Wait()? `
- You don't actually invoke the function, `go func() { ... } `,must be followed by `()`. This cannot compile.. ?

All transactions are ethereum-transactions . Some modify the state of some contracts. Some of those contracts can be e.g. USDT token, but from a block perspective, there's nothing special about it.

There's no such thing as an ERC-20 or tether transactions.

There are only Ethereum transactions, which may interact with the Tether contracts either directly, or indirectly via other contract calls. My guess is that you mixed something up. Where do you have these hashes from that you are trying to find?

There is a list of Ethereum blockchain wallets. And in a certain situation, I need to get information about transactions in a certain block for wallets from this list.

The final result of the function is an array of objects that contains the following information:
1) ETH or USDT
2) Amount (Value)
3) From and to the address
4) Hash of the transaction

If I don't use the function `etclient.Transactionbyhash (context.Background (), txLiteral. Hash ())`, then there is no error (thanks to @holiman), and I can get information about the transaction (from the receipt and txLiteral) not only in ETH, but also in any other token. But, if this transaction is not an ETH, but for example USDT, then I do not get the transaction value.

Here's what I found - https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/26612/get-the-value-of-erc20-tokens-transferred-using-the-etherscan-api

But using hexutil, I can't get this amount:
```
 v, err := hexutil.Decode("0x00000000000000000000000123c8f973")
 if err != nil {
  log.Error().Msg(err.Error())
 }
 fmt.Println(string(v))
```
I get this string -   #��s

Transaction - 0x53fc6fba4e5d35bad0d5ffc060240787fdfc0e50f2906806059ccd31d0f5ffab

> There's no such thing as an ERC-20 or tether transactions.
> 
> There are only Ethereum transactions, which may interact with the Tether contracts either directly, or indirectly via other contract calls. My guess is that you mixed something up. Where do you have these hashes from that you are trying to find?

hexutil.Decode decodes the data into a byte slice. I assume you want to convert it into a decimal number. Please check the appropriate methods https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common/hexutil

> hexutil.Decode decodes the data into a byte slice. I assume you want to convert it into a decimal number. Please check the appropriate methods https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/common/hexutil

Thanks! now I can get the amount of the USDT transaction. But how to understand this is a USDT transaction or ETH?
That is, I need to understand which currency was used in the transaction: USDT or ETH, for example.

This is not an issue with go-ethereum but rather usage advice. Please move this question to the stackexchange: ethereum.stackexchange.com. ETH transactions have the value set in the transaction while USDT transactions are function calls on a smart contract
